column4: doing a manual install, should the swap partition be logical or primary?
:put it as logical
what about /and /boot ?
:they can be primary or extended,but primary is common
cheers dude
: np
: changing layout ? system>preferences>keyboard>layout
Package `console-data' is not installed and no info is available.  -- any way of doing it without installing new packages... How does the GUI application do it?
yes, the GUI program must change something, somehow.. and it must be something already installed... what does it change?
: as you can see you can add languages and change layouts search that for some time
:_ what do you want to be changed
yes, but I am trying to script the keyboard layout change, I cant use a GUI for this... I want to change from US to UK via terminal
: gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf   find line Option  "XkbLayout" "us" and change it to "uk"
I didnt think xorg.conf was used by default anymore. And would a change in their not require an xserver restart before they take effect?
: If you have that line in xorg.conf change it save and close file and reboot
reboot is not an option, this script is for livecd use
: I can not help you with that one sorry
ok no worries, thanks for trying dude
it look it is down
cheers
